SequenceGapReconciliation.name: SequenceGapReconciliation
SequenceGapReconciliation.description: Represents a missing sequence value identified during reconciliation, which can be used later to ensure there are no gaps in the sequence policy numbers.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last accessed sequence gap reconciliation record indirectly, for example, through a list view or related record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp when the current user last viewed a sequence gap reconciliation record. If this value is null, itâ€™s possible that the user only accessed the sequence gap reconciliation record or a related list view (LastReferencedDate), but not viewed the sequence gap reconciliation record itself.

OwnerId.description: Required. The ID of the user who owns a sequence gap reconciliation record.

SequenceGapReconciliationNumber.description: Required. The reconciled sequence pattern value.

SequencePolicyId.description: Required. The parent sequence policy associated with the gap reconciliation. Deleting a sequencing policy automatically removes all its associated criteria.

SequenceValue.description: Required. The number that was missed during sequence policy generation.

Status.description: The current status of the missed number.

SequenceGapReconciliation.accessRules: the Billing Admin permission set to access this object
